intro: Mentha formosana, commonly known as Japanese mint, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, ovate leaves with a serrated edge. Its fragrant, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in summer. Mentha formosana is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its menthol-like aroma.
